title: Escape item
data:
An **escape item** refers to any object that can instantly get you out of trouble. These are the ones you will search your inventory for when cornered by a tough [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster"), being pulled underwater, or something similar. As a general note, scrolls and potions can get destroyed, and some intelligent artifacts will blast you, so you might want to carry one of the less vulnerable cures to each trouble in your main inventory at all times. Being prepared is key to winning NetHack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Frequently useful escape items](#Frequently_useful_escape_items)
- [2 Lesser escape items](#Lesser_escape_items)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 References](#References)
- [5 See also](#See_also)

## Frequently useful escape items

Some common escape items are:

- [Scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation")

  An obvious one — teleports you out.[\[1\]](#cite_note-c-1) A [cursed](/wiki/BUC "BUC") scroll of teleportation is noteworthy as it will not only teleport you away from your current predicament but also place you on a different [dungeon level](/wiki/Dungeon_level "Dungeon level")[\[2\]](#cite_note-warning-2).

- Cursed [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level")

  Moves you through the ceiling to an upper dungeon level.[\[2\]](#cite_note-warning-2)

- [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica")

  Opens a portal for you to any visited [dungeon branch](/wiki/Dungeon_branch "Dungeon branch") when [#invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke").[\[2\]](#cite_note-warning-2)

  - This is unreliable if used too often because [rnz](/wiki/Rnz "Rnz") might draw huge timeouts (up to 2,000 turns).

* [The Orb of Fate](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Fate "The Orb of Fate").

  Can be invoked for level teleportation.[\[2\]](#cite_note-warning-2)

  - This is unreliable if used too often because [rnz](/wiki/Rnz "Rnz") might draw huge timeouts (up to 2,000 turns).

- [Wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging")

  [Zap](/wiki/Zap "Zap") this downwards and fall to the next dungeon level[\[2\]](#cite_note-warning-2), or engrave [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth").

  - You won't fall if a monster is [holding](/wiki/Holding_attack "Holding attack") you.

* [Scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide")

  Can instantly kill the monster that is about to kill you.

  - Note that reading an [uncursed](/wiki/BUC "BUC") scroll of genocide while confused is a very [Bad Idea](/wiki/Bad_Idea "Bad Idea"), and reading a cursed scroll of genocide will create even more monsters rather than getting rid of them.

- [Wand of teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation")

  Same as the scroll, except that the wand gives you the choice of teleporting the monster instead, and a cursed wand won't teleport you to a different level. The wand is much more useful on no-teleport levels, as teleporting monsters will work even on no-teleport levels.[\[1\]](#cite_note-c-1)

- [Wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold")

  If you are being pulled underwater, you can use this wand to freeze the water that the [sea monster](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") is swimming in, thus preventing it from drowning you. It also deals significant damage, and stands a pretty good chance of destroying most early-game threats in one strike.

- [Wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") or [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning")

  Can be used to [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") permanently and quickly. The wand of lightning, however, will blind you, and there are monsters that don't respect [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"). Also, like the [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold"), these can be used to simply nuke the attacking monster. Fire can also be used to cure [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming"). Lightning will not explode when you get [shocked](/wiki/Shock "Shock").

- Non-cursed [scroll of earth](/wiki/Scroll_of_earth "Scroll of earth")

  You can use this one in an open space to create a [boulder fort](/wiki/Boulder_fort "Boulder fort") around you, possibly giving you the time to heal. If it is not blessed, one of the boulders will fall on your head, damaging you. It can also be used to save yourself from a sea monster's [drowning attack](/wiki/Drowning_attack "Drowning attack"), but this has a 10% chance of failure and thus shouldn't be relied on.

- [Wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph")

  Zap that monster that is about to kill you and change it into another (hopefully easier) monster, unless it [resists](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance"). You can also zap yourself with it, using it as a makeshift healing device (if your HP reaches 0 when you are polymorphed, you change back to your original form instead of dying).

  - This should be your last resort, as the monster may very well become much tougher than whatever it was before, or you could kill yourself with system shock, not to mention that using this wand for [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") is a much better use for it. Minotaurs and air elementals engulfing you are worthy targets, though.

* Non-cursed [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame"), including [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane")

  You can engrave [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") in one turn whenever needed.

* [Tooled horn](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn") or [leather drum](/wiki/Leather_drum "Leather drum")

  - Scares monsters, 80% chance, even those that don't respect Elbereth.
  - Can be [resisted](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)").

* [Expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera")

  May [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") or [scare](/wiki/Scare "Scare") seeing monsters, causing them to be less effective at attacking you and/or to flee.

  - [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") will not work on monsters, but does work on eyeless ones.

- [Magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle")

  Summons your pet(s), which can then either attack the monster or block its path to you.

- [Wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death")

  Will kill most enemies in one turn. However, there is a slight chance of missing. Beware of having the beam bounce and hit you (or your pet), unless you have reflection or magic resistance. [(A)pply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") it if you are surrounded (if you can survive the blast damage).

- [Lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") corpse or [potion of acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid")

  Not strictly for running away, but cures stoning in one turn. Note that [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin") of acidic monsters will also work, but take at least two turns to consume, and the spell of [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") has other drawbacks. Don't choke on the lizard.

- [Amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving")

  Remember to put on another one when it's used up!

## Lesser escape items

A few other items have defensive properties that may not be quite so obvious.

- Several attack [wands](/wiki/Wands "Wands") can be thrown at wand-using nasties that have troublesome melee attacks when the player is already immune to them either by [resistances](/wiki/Resistances "Resistances"), [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") or [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").
- [Create monster](/wiki/Create_monster "Create monster") can be used to generate lesser nasties to block some already generated worse ones. In a similar vein a cursed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") is even more practical, but it often has other uses, whereas the wands and scrolls of create monster are typically abundant.

## Strategy

You might want to [assign](/wiki/Adjust "Adjust") fixed [inventory letters](/wiki/Adjust "Adjust") to the following items and carry them in your main inventory at all times:

- a blessed [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- a known-charged [wand of teleport](/wiki/Wand_of_teleport "Wand of teleport")
- a [lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") corpse
- a known-charged [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging")
- a known-charged [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning") or [fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire")

The above selection covers the most common or pressing problems without burdening you down too much.

NetHack is a game of risk management. That's why escape items are so important.

## References

1. ↑ [1.0](#cite_ref-c_1-0) [1.1](#cite_ref-c_1-1) [Covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monsters will still be able to go to you immediately, regardless of how far you are from them.
2. ↑ [2.0](#cite_ref-warning_2-0) [2.1](#cite_ref-warning_2-1) [2.2](#cite_ref-warning_2-2) [2.3](#cite_ref-warning_2-3) [2.4](#cite_ref-warning_2-4) Will not work on [followers](/wiki/Follower "Follower"), who will pursue you if adjacent.

## See also

- [Things To Do If You're Going to Die Next Turn](/wiki/Things_To_Do_If_You%27re_Going_to_Die_Next_Turn "Things To Do If You're Going to Die Next Turn")

Escape item

From NetHackWiki

An escape item refers to any object that can instantly get you out of trouble. These are the ones you will search your inventory for when cornered by a tough monster, being pulled underwater, or something similar. As a general note, scrolls and potions can get destroyed, and some intelligent artifacts will blast you, so you might want to carry one of the less vulnerable cures to each trouble in your main inventory at all times. Being prepared is key to winning NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Frequently useful escape items
  • 2 Lesser escape items
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 References
  • 5 See also

Frequently useful escape items

Some common escape items are:

Scroll of teleportation
An obvious one — teleports you out.[1] A cursed scroll of teleportation is noteworthy as it will not only teleport you away from your current predicament but also place you on a different dungeon level[2].
Cursed potion of gain level
Moves you through the ceiling to an upper dungeon level.[2]
The Eye of the Aethiopica
Opens a portal for you to any visited dungeon branch when #invoked.[2]
This is unreliable if used too often because rnz might draw huge timeouts (up to 2,000 turns).
The Orb of Fate.
Can be invoked for level teleportation.[2]
This is unreliable if used too often because rnz might draw huge timeouts (up to 2,000 turns).
Wand of digging
Zap this downwards and fall to the next dungeon level[2], or engrave Elbereth.
You won't fall if a monster is holding you.
Scroll of genocide
Can instantly kill the monster that is about to kill you.
Note that reading an uncursed scroll of genocide while confused is a very Bad Idea, and reading a cursed scroll of genocide will create even more monsters rather than getting rid of them.
Wand of teleportation
Same as the scroll, except that the wand gives you the choice of teleporting the monster instead, and a cursed wand won't teleport you to a different level. The wand is much more useful on no-teleport levels, as teleporting monsters will work even on no-teleport levels.[1]
Wand of cold
If you are being pulled underwater, you can use this wand to freeze the water that the sea monster is swimming in, thus preventing it from drowning you. It also deals significant damage, and stands a pretty good chance of destroying most early-game threats in one strike.
Wand of fire or wand of lightning
Can be used to engrave Elbereth permanently and quickly. The wand of lightning, however, will blind you, and there are monsters that don't respect Elbereth. Also, like the wand of cold, these can be used to simply nuke the attacking monster. Fire can also be used to cure sliming. Lightning will not explode when you get shocked.
Non-cursed scroll of earth
You can use this one in an open space to create a boulder fort around you, possibly giving you the time to heal. If it is not blessed, one of the boulders will fall on your head, damaging you. It can also be used to save yourself from a sea monster's drowning attack, but this has a 10% chance of failure and thus shouldn't be relied on.
Wand of polymorph
Zap that monster that is about to kill you and change it into another (hopefully easier) monster, unless it resists. You can also zap yourself with it, using it as a makeshift healing device (if your HP reaches 0 when you are polymorphed, you change back to your original form instead of dying).
This should be your last resort, as the monster may very well become much tougher than whatever it was before, or you could kill yourself with system shock, not to mention that using this wand for polypiling is a much better use for it. Minotaurs and air elementals engulfing you are worthy targets, though.
Non-cursed athame, including Magicbane
You can engrave Elbereth in one turn whenever needed.
Tooled horn or leather drum
Scares monsters, 80% chance, even those that don't respect Elbereth.
Can be resisted.
Expensive camera
May blind or scare seeing monsters, causing them to be less effective at attacking you and/or to flee.
Elbereth will not work on monsters, but does work on eyeless ones.
Magic whistle
Summons your pet(s), which can then either attack the monster or block its path to you.
Wand of death
Will kill most enemies in one turn. However, there is a slight chance of missing. Beware of having the beam bounce and hit you (or your pet), unless you have reflection or magic resistance. (A)pply it if you are surrounded (if you can survive the blast damage).
Lizard corpse or potion of acid
Not strictly for running away, but cures stoning in one turn. Note that tins of acidic monsters will also work, but take at least two turns to consume, and the spell of stone to flesh has other drawbacks. Don't choke on the lizard.
Amulet of life saving
Remember to put on another one when it's used up!

Lesser escape items

A few other items have defensive properties that may not be quite so obvious.

  • Several attack wands can be thrown at wand-using nasties that have troublesome melee attacks when the player is already immune to them either by resistances, reflection or magic resistance.
  • Create monster can be used to generate lesser nasties to block some already generated worse ones. In a similar vein a cursed scroll of genocide is even more practical, but it often has other uses, whereas the wands and scrolls of create monster are typically abundant.

Strategy

You might want to assign fixed inventory letters to the following items and carry them in your main inventory at all times:

  • a blessed unicorn horn
  • a known-charged wand of teleport
  • a lizard corpse
  • a known-charged wand of digging
  • a known-charged wand of lightning or fire

The above selection covers the most common or pressing problems without burdening you down too much.

NetHack is a game of risk management. That's why escape items are so important.

References

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 Covetous monsters will still be able to go to you immediately, regardless of how far you are from them.
  2. ↑ 2.0 2.1 2.2 2.3 2.4 Will not work on followers, who will pursue you if adjacent.
